bug.author: opencv-pushbot
bug.summary: BOWKMeansTrainer class is not available in java version
bug.description:
Transferred from <denchmark-link:http://code.opencv.org/issues/3003>http://code.opencv.org/issues/3003</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-code>|| Mohamed Ouederni on 2013-05-02 10:58 || Priority: Normal || Affected: branch 'master' (2.4.9) || Category: java bindings || Tracker: Bug || Difficulty: None || PR: || Platform: None / None </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>BOWKMeansTrainer class is not available in java version</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Hello,
I would to use *BOWKMeansTrainer* to do image classification(http://www.morethantechnical.com/2011/08/25/a-simple-object-classifier-with-bag-of-words-using-opencv-2-3-w-code/).
So, the *BOWKMeansTrainer* is not mapped in the java version of OpenCV (2.4.5). </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h2>History</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h5>Anna Kogan on 2013-05-07 08:02</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>Hello Mohamed, Thank you for reporting the issue. If you could fix the issue on your side, a "pull request":http://www.code.opencv.org/projects/opencv/wiki/How_to_contribute in our GitHub repo would be highly appreciated! - Priority changed from Blocker to Normal - Assignee changed from Andrey Pavlenko to Mohamed Ouederni </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:h5>Anna Kogan on 2013-05-07 08:02</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>- Affected version changed from 2.4.5 (latest release) to branch 'master' (2.4.9) </denchmark-code>
